MDN Train #2621 Delayed
MDN train #2621, scheduled to depart Chicago Union Station at 6:35 PM, is on the move and may be operating 30 to 40 minutes behind schedule due to track construction.

MED Inbound trains will be loading from the north end of the platform at 18th, McCormick Place, 27th and 47th street

MED Inbound trains may be loading from the north end of the platform at 18th, McCormick Place, 27th and 47th street. Please wait on the platform visible to the engineer and follow boarding instructions from the conductor after the train stops.

BNSF 2032 - Delayed
BNSF Train #2032, scheduled to arrive Chicago Union Station at 8:20 PM, is operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due to Gate Malfunction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street. All trains will board passengers from the rear cars on this platform. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  147th St./Sibley Blvd station closed for reconstruction until fall 2024.

The 147th street/Sibley Blvd station is closed for reconstruction until fall 2024. During this time, trains will not stop at this station. As alternates, please use the nearby Ivanhoe or Harvey stations. Updates will be provided once  the rehabilitation is complete and the station is accessible. Metra apologizes for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Track Construction Saturday, September 21 through Sunday, September 22

Track construction will be taking place on Saturday, September 21 through Sunday, September 22. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 20 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.

Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station elevator out of service until further notice
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service until further notice.  Customers can use the elevator located at 205 N Michigan, which leads to the South Water entrance to Millennium Station

Metra Alert UP-N -  Track Construction through Tuesday, September 24.

Union Pacific is conducting a tie replacement project on the UP North Line from Chicago to Highland Park. This work is necessary to keep the tracks safe and in compliance. It is being done in off hours from 8 p.m. to 4 a.m. so that Metra service is not significantly disrupted, but some midday and evening trains may incur delays of up to 30 minutes passing through the work zone. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. Residents near the tracks can expect construction noise as the project moves through their area. Below is the schedule for upcoming work:

  • Tuesday, September 17 to Friday, September 20- Glencoe to Highland Park
  • Saturday, September 21 – West Cortland to Diversey Parkway
  • Sunday, September 22 – Diversey Parkway to West Peterson Ave.
  • Monday, September 23 – West Peterson Ave to West Touhy Ave.
  • Tuesday, September 24 – West Touhy Ave to Washington St. (Evanston)

Thank you for your understanding as UP completes this critical work. We are sorry for any disturbance this will cause for community residents.

Metra Alert UP-W - River Forest Platform 2 Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, May 8, the east half of Platform 2 (island platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the west half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November.

Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.

Metra Alert BNSF - Tracks #2, and #4, out of service at Chicago Union Station.

Tracks #2, and #4, are out of service on the south concourse at Chicago Union Station until further notice due to the Canal St., construction project. BNSF, Southwest Service, and Heritage Corridor passengers should check gate boards prior to boarding their trains. If you need help, please contact Metra personnel for assistance.

Metra Alert HC - Metra to offer Saturday "Rails, Trails and Ales" Excursions on the Heritage Corridor Beginning September 7

Metra will once again be offering special service on the Heritage Corridor Line on six Saturdays this fall, providing opportunities to explore the bike trails, festivals, craft breweries, restaurants, and vibrant communities along this historic route. Full schedules can be found on metra.com.

Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric District Extra Service For Chicago Bears Games
The Metra Electric District will run extra train service for anticipation of larger than normal crowds for the Chicago Bears home games. For more information click here and visit metra.com.

Metra Alert MD-N - Milwaukee North Line Construction Project require Busing on September 21-22

On both Saturday, September 21 and Sunday, September 22 passengers will be bused from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. between the Libertyville and Lake Forest stations due to crossing work at Milwaukee Avenue in Libertyville. This will affect inbound trains 2604 through 2616 and outbound trains 2601 through 2615.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Rock Island Construction Project require Busing on September 21.  Evening Busing Canceled.

Rock Island construction project Saturday, Sept. 21 until 1pm, Rock Island trains will not travel north of 35th Street and Metra passengers will be bused between LaSalle and 35th Street. Passenger may experience delays of at least 15 minutes while traveling through the work zone.

Bus transfers between LaSalle St and 35th Street stations are expected for the following trains: 
•    Saturday morning Sept 21: inbound trains 202 through 310 and outbound trains 205 through 113

Please be advised that the scheduled Saturday evening track construction will be completed early.  As a result, evening trains 230, 234, 233, 235, & 237 will no longer require busing and will make all station stops into Lasalle.
